paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V142I, including penetrance data and individual case details.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient had a heart transplant 1 year before admission for nonischemic cardiomyopathy secondary to transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis from the V142I variant.

functional_data.summary: The V142I variant is the most common cause of variant or hereditary amyloidosis in the United States.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with familial amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is linked to significant clinical manifestations including cardiac and pulmonary involvement.
key_quotes: The patient had a heart transplant 1 year before admission for nonischemic cardiomyopathy secondary to transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis from the V142I variant.
In transthyretin amyloidosis amyloid, the p.V142I variant is the most common cause of variant or hereditary amyloidosis in the United States.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward with clear information on the TTR variant.
